answerText: John Nash[10] This other prominent game theorist collaborated with Oskar Morgenstern on a namesake utility theorem. This man and Morgenstern co-wrote Theory of Games and Economic Behavior, and worked on shape charges for the Manhattan project.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Northwestern A | 13 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer the following about the field of game theory, for 10 points each: [10] This Princeton economist's namesake equilibrium is one of the foundational concepts of game theory. In that equilibrium, none of the players have an incentive to change their strategies.
